page.title: 16COUNTRYSIDE AROUND BALLATER
page.content: The land around Ballater is a mixture of rich farm land and plantations of Scots Pine trees. The hills of Craig Coillich and Craigendarroch provide magnificent views of the surrounding area. Roe deer, red squirrels, foxes, badgers and other Scottish highland wildlife can be found among the pine, larch, oak and birchwoods. Bird life abounds in and around Ballater ranging from buzzards and other birds of prey to the more domesticated chaffinch and robin. Sheep are kept on rough grazing on higher ground. In the winter the local estate workers feed the red deer The once famous spa of Pannanich Wells overlooks the ruined church of Tullich which is now surrounded by grazing cattle. A field of barley conceals an ancient earth-house or soutterain. The area is dominated by the River Dee with its salmon fishing pools.
